Problem:
class WeatherController { void setWeather(String city, boolean isRaining) { if (isRaining) { updateRainGauge(city, 10); } else { updateRainGauge(city, 0); } } void updateRainGauge(String city, int newLevel) { System.out.println('Updated rain gauge for ' + city + ' to ' + newLevel + 'mm'); } }",

If we manually interfere in the code to update the rain gauge level to 5mm, will this impact the value of isRaining?
Explanation: The rain gauge level in the code is only a direct reflection of the isRaining variable value. Manually setting the gauge does not modify the isRaining variable, hence the state of the weather (isRaining) remains unaffected.
